tool.name: ScriptManager: Scaling Factor
tool.command:
ln -s "$input1" "temp_input.bam" && ln -s "$input2" "temp_control.bam" &&
samtools index "temp_input.bam" && samtools index "temp_control.bam" &&
java -jar $__tool_directory__/ScriptManager-v0.14.jar read-analysis scaling-factor
#if str($output_file_name.bool) == "Yes" : -o "$output_file_name.file_name" #end if
#if str($blacklist_file.bool) == "Yes" : -f "$blacklist_file.file_name" #end if
-c "temp_control.bam"
#if str($window_size) != "500" : -w "$window_size" #end if
#if str($min_fraction) != "0.75" : -m "$min_fraction" #end if
#if str($scaling_options) == "total_tag": -t #elif str($scaling_options) == "ncis": -n #elif str($scaling_options) == "both": -b #end if
"temp_input.bam"

param.name: window_size
param.label: Window Size for NCIS-related scaling types

param.name: min_fraction
param.label: Minimum Fraction for NCIS-related scaling types

tool.help: **What it does** Calculate scaling factor as either total tag normalization or normalization of ChIP-seq data with control.
